io.github.pr0methean.betterrandom.prng

Class BaseRandom

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Random
      • io.github.pr0methean.betterrandom.prng.BaseRandom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ByteArrayReseedableRandom, EntropyCountingRandom, RepeatableRandom, Dumpable, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AesCounterRandom, BaseSplittableRandomAdapter, CellularAutomatonRandom, Cmwc4096Random, MersenneTwisterRandom, RandomWrapper, XorShiftRandom

    public abstract class BaseRandom
extends Random
implements ByteArrayReseedableRandom, RepeatableRandom, Dumpable, EntropyCountingRandom
    Abstract Random with a seed field and an implementations of entropy counting.
    Author:
    Chris Hennick
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        SeedException - if any.

      • BaseRandom

        public BaseRandom(SeedGenerator seedGenerator,
                  int seedLength)
           throws SeedException
        Creates a new RNG and seeds it using the provided seed generation strategy.
        Parameters:
        seedGenerator - The seed generation strategy that will provide the seed value for this RNG.
        seedLength - The seed length in bytes.
        Throws:
        SeedException - If there is a problem generating a seed.

        protected BaseRandom(long seed)
        Creates a new RNG with the provided seed. Only works in subclasses that can accept an 8-byte or shorter seed.
        Parameters:
        seed - the seed.

      • entropyOfInt

        protected static long entropyOfInt(int origin,
                                   int bound)
        Parameters:
        origin - the minimum, inclusive.
        bound - the maximum, exclusive.
        Returns:
        the entropy in bits, rounded up, of a random int between origin and bound.

      • entropyOfLong

        protected static long entropyOfLong(long origin,
                                    long bound)
        Parameters:
        origin - the minimum, inclusive.
        bound - the maximum, exclusive.
        Returns:
        the entropy in bits, rounded up, of a random long between origin and bound.

      • withProbability

        public final boolean withProbability(double probability)
        The purpose of this method is so that entropy-counting subclasses can detect that no more than 1 bit of entropy is actually being consumed, even though this method uses nextDouble() which normally consumes 53 bits. Tracking of fractional bits of entropy is currently not implemented in BaseRandom.
        Parameters:
        probability - The probability of returning true.
        Returns:
        True with probability probability; false otherwise. If probability < 0, always returns false. If probability >= 1, always returns true.

      • withProbabilityInternal

        protected boolean withProbabilityInternal(double probability)
        Called by withProbability(double) to generate a boolean with a specified probability of returning true, after special cases (probability 0 or less, or 1 or more) have been eliminated.
        Parameters:
        probability - The probability of returning true; always strictly between 0 and 1.
        Returns:
        True with probability probability; false otherwise.

      • next

        protected abstract int next(int bits)
        Generates the next pseudorandom number. Called by all other random-number-generating methods. Should not debit the entropy count, since that's done by the calling methods according to the amount they actually output.
        Overrides:
        next in class Random

      • internalNextGaussian

        protected double internalNextGaussian(java.util.function.DoubleSupplier nextDouble)
        Core of a lockless reimplementation of nextGaussian().
        Parameters:
        nextDouble - shall return a random number between 0 and 1, like nextDouble(), but shall not debit the entropy count.
        Returns:
        a random number that is normally distributed with mean 0 and standard deviation 1.

        public void setSeederThread(@Nullable RandomSeederThread thread)
        Registers this PRNG with the given RandomSeederThread to schedule reseeding when we run out of entropy. Unregisters
        Parameters:
        thread - a RandomSeederThread that will be used to reseed this PRNG.

      • preferSeedWithLong

        public boolean preferSeedWithLong()
        Specified by:
        preferSeedWithLong in interface ByteArrayReseedableRandom
        Returns:
        true if Random.setSeed(long) will tend to perform better than ByteArrayReseedableRandom.setSeed(byte[]).

      • setSeedInternal

        @EnsuresNonNull(value={"this.seed","entropyBits"})
protected void setSeedInternal(@UnknownInitialization(value=java.util.Random.class) BaseRandom this,
                                                                                  byte[] seed)
        Sets the seed, and should be overridden to set other state that derives from the seed. Called by setSeed(byte[]), whose default implementation ensures that the lock is held while doing so. Also called by constructors, readObject(ObjectInputStream) and readObjectNoData().
        Parameters:
        seed - The new seed.

      • initTransientFields

        @EnsuresNonNull(value={"lock","longSeedArray","longSeedBuffer"})
protected void initTransientFields(@UnknownInitialization BaseRandom this)
        Called in constructor and readObject to initialize transient fields.

      • entropyBits

        public long entropyBits()
        Description copied from interface: EntropyCountingRandom
        Returns an estimate of the current amount of entropy.
        Specified by:
        entropyBits in interface EntropyCountingRandom
        Returns:
        The current estimated amount of entropy. Every time the PRNG is reseeded, the entropy count is set to the new seed's length; and every time it is used, it is decreased by the number of random bits in the output rounded up. The amount of entropy can go below zero, giving an indication of how far the entropy has been stretched. This estimate is a lower bound if the seed is perfectly random and is not being reused.

      • recordEntropySpent

        protected void recordEntropySpent(long bits)
        Record that entropy has been spent, and schedule a reseeding if this PRNG has now spent as much as it's been seeded with.
        Parameters:
        bits - The number of bits of entropy spent.

      • fallbackSetSeed

        @EnsuresNonNull(value="seed")
protected void fallbackSetSeed(@UnknownInitialization BaseRandom this)
        Generates a seed using the default seed generator. For use in handling a setSeed(long) call in subclasses that can't actually use an 8-byte seed.

      • recordAllEntropySpent

        protected void recordAllEntropySpent()

      • getNewSeedLength

        public abstract int getNewSeedLength(@UnknownInitialization BaseRandom this)
        Description copied from interface: ByteArrayReseedableRandom
        Returns the preferred length of a new byte-array seed. The meaning of "preferred" may vary in implementations that support multiple seed lengths, but it should probably usually mean the longest supported seed length, since the longer the seed, the more random the output.
        Specified by:
        getNewSeedLength in interface ByteArrayReseedableRandom
        Returns:
        The desired length of a new byte-array seed.
